result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Samuel Clausing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Samuel Clausing appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for David Samuel Clausing.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 22CM692 for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for David Samuel Clausing.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Due to court calendar congestion, Court adjourns the matter for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 35.  **Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.C.A.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@1:30pm

03/21/2022 sa
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/2/22 @ 1:30p
